Once you have got the OpenCms source and have it present in a Gradle project, you can configure:

  • the path where builds are placed: Therefore edit gradle.properties in the project's main folder and edit the entry build_directory.

Once configuration is done, you can build your project with Gradle. Therefore:

  • Choose "Run as" -> "External tools configurations ..."
  • Choose "Gradle Build" -> "{project name}"
  • Choose appropriate targets
  • Click "Run"

You will have a lot of targets to choose from for building OpenCms. Here are the interesting ones.
